TcAttribute.description: Vendor property is a typed reference pointing to the Vendor in Teamcenter who has provided the quote. The property is generally used when it is important to store the reference of the vendor directly. The quotes are generally put on the lineitems which have the relevant metadata regarding providing vendors.

bid_package_type is a string property used to store the type of the Bidpackage. This property helps consuming applications facilitate identifying the types of bids. The property can be populated at the time of creation of Bidpackage. It can be modified later on.

line_item is an array property of typed references to BidPackageLineItem objects. There can be multiple line items created for a given Bid Package Content. Line Items can be added on content object using application through adding line items on bid package revision. The implementation in the background adds the line item on the bid package content corresponding to the revision. The values are used for display and reference on parent Bid Package Revision using getter methods in the implementation.

configuration_context is a typed reference property to specify in which scenarios or configurations, the parent Line Item object is relevant. With the help of this context information, one can have many Line Items for a single artifact collection where user can make sure only one of them is relevant at a given time and configuration. The referenced object is of type LineItemConfigContext which is used to set the context as mentioned here in many applications including Product Structures.

Part is an untyped reference property used to denote the reference to the artifact in Teamcenter against which the procurement is taking place. The Line Item can be configured for only one artifact at a time.
quantity double property used to denote the order bulk size specified for the bidding of the given part or artifact.

cust_line_item_attrs is a an untyped reference property. It is used to store all the custom metadata one needs to save alongside of a line item. The content attached to the property may vary according to the use and domain.

Reqd_date is a Date property used to record the date at which the new bid request was made. It is used for tracking and other purposes. The property value is typically set at the time of the creation of Bid Package Revision.

Req_purpose is a string property used to set the purpose of the new bid process recorded. It does not serve any functional value. Its initial value is empty unless specified. Its value is typically set during the creation of the Bid Package Revision.

Bid_package_content is a typed reference property used to store the content placeholder for the bis package revision. All the meta data is stored on this background content object. The data stored on this referenced object is generally accessed through compound properties and run time getters on the Bid Package Revision itself. The Content object is only used in the core implementation and not in application.

Vendor_status is a string property used to denote the status of the Vendor when the Vendor has assumed Distributor Role. The possible values of the status are kept open due to varying nature of the application domains of this functionality. The status is set at the time of creation of the Form object. It is generally not changed afterwards. The information is not used directly OOTB for any functional component and is used typically for reports and dashboards.
View_type is a typed reference property to PSViewType object. This property denotes the type of the view the parent configuration context applies.

vm0vendor_ref is a typed reference property used to indicate the Vendor who has provided the Vendor Part. This property is used over the legacy relation property TC_vendor_part_rel to access Vendor in customization. There can be only one Vendor at a time. There is a Change Vendor process in case the Vendor needs to be changed. It is recommended to follow the process instead of changing the property manually.

vm0company_location is a typed reference property to attach a CompanyLocation object to Vendor Part. Vendor Part can be assigned only one location at a time. This location needs to be also part of the locations assigned originally on the parent Vendor.

Vendor_status is a string property used to denote the status of the Vendor when the Vendor has assumed Manufacturer Role. The possible values of the status are kept open due to varying nature of the application domains of this functionality. The status is set at the time of creation of the Form object. It is generally not changed afterwards. The information is not used directly OOTB for any functional component and is used typically for reports and dashboards.

Quoted_quantity is the double property used to denote the quantity of the offer. It may or may not be same as the quantity mentioned on the original Bid Package. Multiple quotes from same Vendor can make up the quantity.
Unit_price is a float property used to denote the unit price of the offered artifact.

Tooling_cost is a float property used to represent the tooling cost for the artifact. The way the tooling cost and unit price are handled may be different and thus will influence the way the total cost of the quote calculated.
Currency is a string property used to represent the currency in which the offer is made.

Vendor_status is a string property used to denote the status of the Vendor when the Vendor has assumed Supplier Role. The possible values of the status are kept open due to varying nature of the application domains of this functionality. The status is set at the time of creation of the Form object. It is generally not changed afterwards. The information is not used directly OOTB for any functional component and is used typically for reports and dashboards.

certification_status is a string property used to indicate the certification of the supplier. It is obtained generally through third party agencies. The certification status determines the application of the Vendor in Vendor Management in Supplier role.OOTB not business logic is built around this property. It is however used in customization as trigger for managing the Vendor status and potential use in Teamcenter.

preferred_status is a string property used to store the status of the Vendor Part attached in the reference of the internal part or design revision. The property is attached to LOV PreferredStatus which has default possible values as Preferred and Backup. The value is used to indicate if the vendor part is to be preferred over peer vendor parts for the same design or part revision in applications like grading, product structure, and other applications which need single representation of part. This value changes the way the parts are displayed for given product structure node if the display configuration is selected as such. Other applications such as Substance Compliance may use this property to decide a representative Vendor Part in multi sourcing scenario. The property is generally set using UI menu after the relation is created. Once set, this value typically does not change. It can be changed over the lifetime of the relation.
Supplier_addr is a string property used to store the street address of the Vendor. It is a legacy property and it is now recommended to use company location object for this information.
web_site is a string property used to store the web site of the Vendor. It is a legacy property and it is now recommended to use company location object for this information.
supplier_phone is a string property used to store the phone number of the Vendor. It is a legacy property and it is not recommended to use company contact object for this information.
Email_addr is a string property used to store the email address of the Vendor. It is a legacy property and it is now recommended to use company contact object for this information.
Contact_name is a string property used to store the contact name of the Vendor. It is a legacy property and it is now recommended to use company contact object for this information.
Vendor_group is an untyped reference property to specify the classification group the vendor belongs to. This is a legacy property and classification module is now recommended for achieving this.
Part is a typed reference property used to attach the supplier part to the identifier. It is deprecated and the object is no longer used.
Preferred_status is a string attribute to denote whether the supplier part provided should be preferred in the consuming application. It is deprecated and the object is no longer used.
Comments is a string property used to capture general comments on the Vendor Revision. It may include some metadata on the Vendor Revision or may as well include reasons for revision etc.
Vendor_role_list is a typed reference array property used to store the Vendor Role objects on Vendor Revision. A Vendor Revision can have multiple roles or no roles depending on the application.
Vendor_role_name is a string property used to store the name of the vendor role. The role is identified in UI and in other applications by this name.
Description is a string property used to store the description of the vendor role. It typically stores the information about the responsibilities and characteristics of the role.

Vendor_role_info is a typed reference property which points to the Form object containing additional data about the role. Typically this information is filled in with the help of a UI or application. The form object is typically set at the time of creation of the role and then it keeps unchanged.

Vm0DUNSNumber is a string property used to store DUNS number usually associated to the location of a specific Vendor. The Data Universal Numbering System, abbreviated as DUNS or D-U-N-S, is a proprietary system developed and regulated by Dun & Bradstreet (D&B) that assigns a unique numeric identifier, referred to as a "DUNS number" to a single business entity. In the context of Vendor Management, it more often used to denote specific Vendor locations. The property can assume null or empty value. Once set, it is generally not changed for a location in Vendor.

vm0company_location is a typed reference property to attach a CompanyLocation object to Vendor Part. Vendor Part can be assigned only one location at a time. This location needs to be also part of the locations assigned originally on the parent Vendor.

TcForm.description: BaseQuote object is a form used to store information about a quote a Vendor has provided. This is the base object used to store the vendor providing the quote. To store the complete information about a general quote, Quote object is used which is a subtype of BaseQuote object.
MasterForm object for "CommercialPart Revision" business object

DistributorInfo is a Form object used to store the metadata for Distributor Role. Distributor is one of the roles which can be assumed by a supplier in Teamcenter. This object is a background object needed for additional properties on Distributor roles. For every Vendor Role a corresponding Form object is needed.

ManufacturerInfo is a Form object used to store the metadata for Manufacturer Role. Manufacturer is one of the roles which can be assumed by a supplier in Teamcenter. This object is a background object needed for additional properties on Manufacturer roles. For every Vendor Role, a corresponding Form object is needed.
MasterForm object for "ManufacturerPart Revision" business object

Quote object is used to represent the collection of the offer from the Vendor for a Teamcenter artifact and all the associated metadata. Quotes are generally used in the reference of a Bid Package in Teamcenter. For each of the part up for bidding, there are bid package line items present. Quotes can be attached to specific line items to represent the offer by Vendor for the specified part or artifact. The object is a type of a Form in Teamcenter.Quote objects can be added or removed from a Bid Package Line Items. They do not generally exist without the context of the Line Item.

SupplierInfo is a Form object used to store the metadata for Supplier Role. Supplier is one of the roles which can be assumed by a supplier in Teamcenter. This object is a background object needed for additional properties on Supplier roles. For every Vendor Role, a corresponding Form object is needed.

TcStandardType.description: Form Storage object for "BaseQuote" business object

BidPackage object represents the collection of bids received from vendors for a specific part or any other object in Teamcenter. The Bidpackage is a placeholder container object. Its revisions represent bid events happening from specific vendors for different Parts or Designs in Teamcenter.

BidPackageContent object is the placeholder object used to store the supplier data for Bid Package Revisions. This is a bookkeeping object which is used for internally storing data such as line items specific to Bid Package Revision. The object is generally not used outside the context of the Bid Package Revisions. It is also not a common practice to create the content object through UI. The content object is created at the time of creating the Bidpackage revision itself. The lifecycle of this object is tightly coupled with that of parent Bid Package Revision. Single content object is referred by only one Bid Package Revision.

BidPackageLineItem object is used to represent the real world line item for a bid event when the suppliers are bidding to provide quotes for a specific set of artifacts in Teamcenter.Each Line Item introduced in the context of a Bid Package represents a logical group of all such parts for which there can be a single quotation procured. Such items or artifacts can grouped under the umbrella to also have common metadata such as bulk or unit price, quantity, part references etc. Line Items serve this purpose.Line Items are added or removed on Bid Package Revisions. They contain information about the referenced objects up for bidding or quotes, the configuration context of the Line Item, quantity for bulk orders, group quotes. It can also store custom metadata depending on the consuming application.

TcProperty.description: TC_part_quote_rel is a relation property which attaches Quote objects to Bid Package Line Items. The Quotes can be from multiple suppliers for the same artifact.

TcStandardType.description: Form Storage object for "BidPackage Master" business object
ItemRevision object for "BidPackage" business object

TcProperty.description: lineitems is a run time array property which fetches the line items stored on the Bid Package content attached to the revision. The property is mostly used for both display and manipulation of the line items on bid package revision.

TcStandardType.description: Form Storage object for "BidPackageRevision Master" business object

CommercialPart object is used as the OEM representation of relevant Vendor Parts in Teamcenter. Conceptually the Vendor Part belongs to the specific supplier. The Commercial Part is the OEM version of the Vendor Part which can be directly used in other Teamcenter applications such as product design, lifecycle analysis, and structure management.A Commercial Part can contain multiple Vendor Parts sourced from multiple Vendors and locations. Commercial Parts can take part in product structures just like item revisions and possess identical behavioral components. The associated Vendor Parts contain vendor related metadata.Vendor Parts can be attached to both Commercial Part and Commercial Part Revisions using the relation VMRepresents. It is highly recommended to use the revision in Teamcenter to store Vendor Part data.

TcProperty.description: vendors is a runtime array property which fetches the Vendors of the Vendor Parts attached to a particular commercial part. They are solely used for display and reporting and cannot be directly modified through the property.
vendorparts is a runtime array property which shows the vendor parts associated with commercial part. Vendor Parts can be set on the commercial part revision using this property.

TcStandardType.description: ItemRevision object for "CommercialPart" business object

TcProperty.description: vendors is a runtime array property which fetches the Vendors of the Vendor Parts attached to a particular commercial part revision. They are solely used for display and reporting and cannot be directly modified through the property.
vendorparts is a runtime array property which shows the vendor parts associated with commercial part revision. Vendor Parts can be set on the commercial part revision using this property.
vendorpartrelations is a runtime array property to fetch the relation objects used to relate the vendor parts to commercial part revisions. It is part of legacy data model and not used much anymore.

TcStandardType.description: Form Storage object for "CommercialPart Master" business object
Form Storage object for "CommercialPart Revision Master" business object
Form Storage object for "DistributorInfo" business object

LineItemConfigurationContext object is used to set the context to the parent Line Item. It enables the Line Item to be relevant only for a certain environment or configuration. The object behaves in the same manner as its parent Configuration Context object. This object is used especially for Bid Package Line Items.

ManufacturerPart object is used to represent the Vendor contribution towards the definition of an OEM piece part or Design. ManufacturerPart is an internal legacy name for what is now known as Vendor Part everywhere.Vendor Parts are the backbone of the supplier data model structure when it comes to representing design or parts in Teamcenter. Vendor Parts are widely used in many consuming applications such as Supplier Collaboration, Substance Compliance, IMDS Integration, and so on. Whenever suppliers provide new artifacts, Vendor Parts are created in Teamcenter to represent them.Vendor Part objects presently has MFK defined on it with a combination of Vendor, Item ID, and Location. Different Vendor Parts need to be created with same ID and Vendor for different locations. It is also possible to have the Vendor Parts with same IDs as those of their parent commercial parts in Teamcenter.Once created Vendor Part typically stays on unless it is specifically purged.

TcProperty.description: Vendors is a legacy runtime property to fetch the vendors with Vendor Part. There is in fact only one Vendor for a Vendor Part. This property is hardly used anymore.
Commercialparts is a runtime property to fetch the objects which reference the Vendor Part using VMRepresents relation.
TC_Quality_Document is a relation property used to attach Vendor metadata specific to the Vendor Part. It can be certification documents, test results, lab reports.

ProvidedFrom is a legacy relation property which has been kept only for backward compatibility for existing customizations. The function of this property is same as that of vm0_company _locaiton property on Vendor Part.
Vm0location is a runtime property used to fetch the company location assigned to Vendor Part. It is used only for reports and dashboards.

TcStandardType.description: ItemRevision object for "ManufacturerPart" business object

TcProperty.description: TC_Quality_Document is relation property used to attach Quality Documents used as metadata on the Vendor Part Revision. These documents are generally provided by Vendors. Most typical place to store them is on either Vendors or Vendor Parts. This property is thus used seldom.

TcStandardType.description: Form Storage object for "ManufacturerPart Master" business object
Form Storage object for "ManufacturerPart Revision Master" business object
Form Storage object for "ManufacturerInfo" business object

ProvidedFrom is a relation object used to relate a location to a vendor part.A single Vendor Part can have multiple locations defined using ProvidedFrom relation. This relation object has been deprecated and is no longer used. The property vm0company_location needs to be used instead to specify a company location on a Vendor Part. It is important to note that vm0company_location can have only one company location assigned. For multiple locations, one needs to create multiple vendor parts as intended in the data model.
Form Storage object for "Quote" business object
Form Storage object for "SupplierInfo" business object

TC_Quality_Document object is used to attach a document to a Vendor, Vendor Revision, or Vendor Part. The quality document might be a dataset or a document revision object which contains documents related to the quality assessment of the supplier. These documents typically represent the declarations of the quality from the supplier for a given Vendor Part or for all the parts supplied by the Vendor. The relation does not carry any attribute on it. The primary and secondary objects of this relation do not typically change.

TC_part_quote_rel object is used to relate the quote objects to other objects like line items. Typical use includes adding Quotes to Bid Package Line Items. The object is used only to establish the link for Quote objects to other objects in Teamcenter. There are no specific properties on this relation. The primary and secondary objects for the relation are typically not changed over the lifetime of this relation object.

TC_vendor_id_context_rel object is now deprecated and its use has been replaced by relations TC_vendor_part_rel and VMRepresents. This object was used to relate Identifier objects to Vendors. These Identifier objects were used to denote the Vendor Part and preferred status of the Part in the context of its parent placeholder (Typically a Commercial Part). The Identifier used to be connected to the placeholder object with relation IMAN_aliasid.Now Vendor Parts are connected with Vendors using TC_vendor_part_rel relation. The vendor Parts are connected to OEM placeholders (can be Commercial Part or Design) using VMRepresents.

TC_vendor_part_rel object is used to relate Vendor to a Vendor Part object. This relation is established at the time of creation of a vendor part and usually not modified unless user chooses to change the vendor without copy. The relation is often used for many important parts of the business logic. The relation is however slowly getting replaced by typed reference property called vm0vendor_ref everywhere. It is recommended to use vm0vendor_ref property to use in customization.

VMRepresents is a relation object used to attach Vendor Parts to Item Revisions. This relation is used to show the Vendor Representation of the part revision\design revision used internally at OEM. In Vendor Management application, commercial part revisions are usually used in place of item revisions. The relation also supports them. The relation is used generally to traverse down from an item revision to its vendor representation. The secondary object of the relation is always restricted to Vendor Part. This relation is used typically in applications like Vendor Management, Substance Compliance, and IMDS Integration.

Vendor object is representation of the supplier in Teamcenter. It is the backbone of the Vendor Management data model. The Vendor object acts as a reference placeholder for supplier data. It assumes different roles in Teamcenter for different configurations.Vendor object is generally created when a new supplier is added to the supply chain of an OEM. Most of the times the process is automated and the Vendors are populated using some third party data which is coming from Suppliers.Vendors can be marked as active, inactive, and restricted. Restricted Vendors have limited functionality available to them. Once created, usually vendors are not deleted. If one wishes to omit an existing Vendor from all Vendor Management functions and behaviors, they have to be marked inactive or restricted after the metadata is successfully migrated if needed.

TcProperty.description: Commercialparts is a runtime property used to fetch the objects in Teamcenter associated with the Vendor Parts of the Vendor using VMRepresents relation. The resultant objects may or may not be commercial parts.
Vendorparts is a runtime property used to fetch all the Vendor Parts associated with the Vendor.

TC_Quality_Document is a relation property used to attach additional supplier metadata which denotes quality of the supplier artifacts. It may include certifications, test results, or lab reports etc.

TcStandardType.description: VendorIdentifier is a legacy object in Teamcenter data model. It is used to relate a part or design to a supplier object such as Vendor Part. It is recommended to use VMRepresents for all such purposes. The use of this object is now deprecated.
Form Storage object for "Vendor Master" business object
ItemRevision object for "Vendor" business object

TcProperty.description: TC_Quality_Document is a relation property used to attach additional supplier metadata which denotes quality of the supplier artifacts. It may include certifications, test results, or lab reports etc.
Vendor_role_info is a runtime property used to fetch vendor role information. The information is stored on a form and is used for reports and dashboards.

TcStandardType.description: VendorRole object is used to identify in which capacity the parent vendor object is working in Teamcenter. The VendorRole object has the information about the name of the role assumed, its description, and also a pointer to the form object which stores additional metadata specific to the given vendor role. There can be multiple vendor roles assigned to single vendor. The roles can be added or removed during the lifecycle of the Vendor.
Form Storage object for "VendorRevision Master" business object

TcProperty.description: TC_vendor_part_rel is relation property used to attach the Items to the corresponding Vendors in case the artifacts coming from Vendors are not Vendor Parts. It is not used much anymore and most of the Vendor data is exchanged on Vendor Parts.

VMRepresents is relation property used to relate a Vendor Part to parent Item object. This property is used in case Vendor Part is needed to be attached to an Item instead of a commercial part. The most typical use of this relation is with Commercial Part Revision object and not Item.

VMRepresents is relation property used to relate Vendor Part with Item Revision in case an internal Design or Part revision is to be associated with an externally sourced piece part. The general use case here is when a CAD design revision goes through the various PLM applications and is finally accepted or released for production, it is sometimes decided to procure the design externally. In such case, an external piece part representation (Vendor Part) has to be attached to the original Design or Part Revision object. This property serves the purpose in such cases.

OperationInputProperty.description: Added DUNSNumber property to the create input descriptor

TcCompoundPropertyRule.description: Vendor_part_num is a compound property which fetches its value from attribute with same name on the master form of its parent Item. This is a legacy data model attribute and is no longer used in active application implementation.
Vendor_id is a compound property which fetches the item id of the Vendor object associated with the Vendor Part
Vendor_locations is a runtime property to fetch locations attached with legacy relation ProvidedFrom. It is not used anymore.
Vendor_name is the compound property used to fetch the name of the Vendor object associated with the Vendor Part
Vendor_part_num is the compound property used to fetch the Vendor Part Number property value stored on the master form of the Vendor Part object.

Condition.description: Specifies that all vendor representations of a part be displayed in Structure Manager. This condition is used as an option for the vendor part selection rule and is used to filter the list of displayed vendor parts.
Condition.name: showAllVendorParts

Condition.description: Specifies that only preferred vendor representations of a part be displayed in Structure Manager. This condition is used as an option for the vendor part selection rule and is used to filter the list of displayed vendor parts.
Condition.name: showPreferredVendorPartsOnly

TcTypeConstant.name: CompanyRelationType

ServiceInterface.description:
The Vendor Management service exposes operations that are used to address Vendor Management related functionalities. Common uses of this service are to create, modify and delete Vendor Management complex objects through different operations.

This service provides following Vendor Management use cases.
    • Create or update of BidPackage, Vendor Part, Vendor, BidPackage Line Item,
    • Deletion of BidPackage Line Item, Vendor,
    • Change Vendor of an existing Vendor Part,
    • Fetching Vendor Parts based on a selection rule,
    • Add or remove Vendor roles to or from a Vendor.
ServiceInterface.name: VendorManagement

ServiceInterface.description:
The Vendor Management service exposes operations that are used to address Vendor Management related functionalities. Common uses of this service are to create, modify and delete Vendor Management complex objects through different operations.

This service provides following Vendor Management use cases.
    • Create or update of BidPackage, Vendor Part, Vendor, BidPackage Line Item,
    • Deletion of BidPackage Line Item, Vendor,
    • Change Vendor of an existing Vendor Part,
    • Fetching Vendor Parts based on a selection rule,
    • Add or remove Vendor roles to or from a Vendor.
ServiceInterface.name: VendorManagement

Struct.description: Structure containing an item_id and a reference to an existing object with that ID.
Struct.name: ItemIDData

StructElement.description: A unique string supplied by the caller which comes through input data.
StructElement.name: clientId

StructElement.description: Existing Item object with the same item_id. The presence of this object indicates that the item already exists in the system, or that the supplied combination of external <font face="courier" height="10">objectID</font> and <font face="courier" height="10">contextID</font> is not unique.
StructElement.name: itemID

StructElement.description: Object tag of an existing item with the same item_id. The presence of this tag indicates that the item already exists in the system, or that the supplied combination of external object ID and context ID is not unique.
StructElement.name: existingObject

Struct.description: A structure of external IDs and context IDs. This data is used to generate the Item IDs with context. It will also be used to compare and find out existing Item with such ID.
Struct.name: ItemIDInput

StructElement.description: A unique string supplied by the caller. This ID is used to identify returned <font face="courier" height="10">ItemData</font> elements and Partial Errors associated with this <font face="courier" height="10">ItemIDInput</font>.
StructElement.name: clientId

StructElement.description: The object ID provided from the external system. The assumption is that this ID is unique within the supplied context.
StructElement.name: externalObjectID

StructElement.description: An ID designating the external system, usually the ID of a vendor or a partner company providing the Item information.
StructElement.name: contextID

Struct.description: Response structure for <font face="courier" height="10">getItemIDwithContext</font>
Struct.name: ItemIDResponse

StructElement.description: A list of ItemIDData structures which essentially denote generated IDs with potential existing Item with the generated ID. Errors\Partial errors will sit with standard Teamcenter ServiceData structure.
StructElement.name: itemData

StructElement.description: Standard <font face="courier" height="10">ServiceData</font> structure. It contains partial errors and failures along with the clientIds.
StructElement.name: serviceData

Struct.name: LineItemPropsWithType

StructElement.description: Name of the BidPackageLineItem to be created.
StructElement.name: name

StructElement.description: Description of the BidPackageLineItem Object.
StructElement.name: description

StructElement.description: Name of the BidPackageLineItemConfigContext to be created.
StructElement.name: liccname

StructElement.description: Description of the BidPackageLineItemConfigContext to be created.
StructElement.name: liccdesc

StructElement.description: Id of the part to be associated with BidPackageLineItem.
StructElement.name: partid

StructElement.description: PSView Type to be associated with BidPackageLineItemConfigContext.
StructElement.name: viewtype

StructElement.description: Quantity to be created for BidPackageLineItem objects.
StructElement.name: quantity

StructElement.description: Revision rule to be associated with BidPackageLineItemConfigContext.
StructElement.name: revRule

StructElement.description: Variant rule to be associated with BidPackageLineItemConfigContext.
StructElement.name: varRule

StructElement.description: Closure rule to be associated with BidPackageLineItemConfigContext.
StructElement.name: closureRule

StructElement.description: BidPackageQuote object to be added to BidPackageLineItem.

StructElement.description: BidPackageLineItem Type name to be used.
StructElement.name: bpliTypeName

Struct.description: A structure containing name and expression of a condition entry.
Struct.name: ConditionData

StructElement.description: The name of condition.
StructElement.name: condName

OperationTemplate.description:
This service operation concatenates external object id and context id with hyphen to generate a new item id, provided length of concatenated id is less than the desired item id length. This operation also returns existing Item objects that have the generated IDs.
The intent of this operation is to support import of Item objects from external systems. This service operation concatenates external object id and context id with hyphen to generate a new item id, provided length of concatenated id is less than the desired item id length. This operation also returns existing Item objects that have the generated IDs.
The intent of this operation is to support import of Item objects from external systems.
OperationTemplate.name: Teamcenter::Soa::Internal::Vendormanagement::VendorManagement::getItemIDwithContext
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
A list of ItemIDData structures which contain item_id and references to existing objects with those IDs. Failure will be with client id and error message in the ServiceData.

Typical Errors returned would be:

    • Error 229016: In case the combination of input.externalObjectID and input.contextID becomes larger than maximum allowed length for item ID (128), it will throw an exception mentioning the same.
    • Error 229009, 48043: Standard exceptions while trying to look for an existing Item with generated Item ID will also be thrown back.

OperationParameter.description: A structure of external IDs and context IDs. This data is used to generate the Item IDs with context. It will also be used to compare and find out existing Item with such ID.
OperationParameter.name: input

OperationTemplate.description: This internal service operation gets a list of conditions to use for VendorPart Selection Rule. The Response structure returned contains a list of condition names and their expressions.
OperationTemplate.name: Teamcenter::Soa::Internal::Vendormanagement::VendorManagement::getVPSRConditions
OperationTemplate.returnDescription: <font face="courier" height="10">GetVPSRConditionsResponse</font> structure returned contains a list of <font face="courier" height="10">ConditionData</font> which contains conditions information. Failures will be with client id and error message in the <font face="courier" height="10">ServiceData</font>.

OperationTemplate.description:
This service operation creates or updates a group of BidPackageLineItem objects in the context of the mentioned BidPackage. This operation allows the user to find or create a set of BidPackageLineItem objects based on the input data. It first tries to find the existence of the specified BidPackageLineItem for the specified BidPackage. If the specified BidPackageLineItem is found, then the BidPackageLineItem data will be updated. Otherwise, it will create the specified BidPackageLineItem and associate it to the specified BidPackageRevision. If the specified BidPackageLineItem objects exist and any of the input attribute values differ from those already set, the BidPackageLineItem objects will be updated.
The operation is now deprecated. It is now replaced by Teamcenter::Soa::Vendormanagement::VendorManagement::createOrUpdateLineItemsWithType.
OperationTemplate.name: Teamcenter::Soa::Internal::Vendormanagement::VendorManagement::createOrUpdateLineItems
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
Standard Teamcenter ServiceData instance is returned. Failure will be with client id and error message in the ServiceData.

Typical errors returned are:
    • Error 229024: Error while creating or updating BidPackageLineItems
    • Error 229020: Error while adding the BidPackageLineItems to the BidPackageRevision.
    • Error 48014, 229024: Errors while processing rules (Revision, Variant or Closure) for LineItemConfigContext.

OperationParameter.description: A list of LineItemPropsWithType structures which are used to create or update BidPackageLineItem objects.
OperationParameter.name: properties

OperationParameter.description: Reference to the BidPackageRevision object which will be used to associate the created BidPackageLineItem objects.
OperationParameter.name: bidPackage

OperationTemplate.description: This operation adds or removes set of roles to/from a VendorRevision. Typically a role can be assigned to a VendorRevision by adding a role form with different role specific information. OOTB VendorRevision can be assigned with 3 roles namely Distributor, Supplier and Manufacturer. All these role forms contain information about the Vendor based on the type of the role. Similarly a role can be revoked from a VendorRevision. When a Vendor is revised, the new revision inherits all the assigned roles to the previous VendorRevision.
OperationTemplate.name: Teamcenter::Soa::Vendormanagement::VendorManagement::addRemoveVendorRoles
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
The partial errors and failures are updated and returned through the object ServiceData.
Typical errors returned are:
    • Error 480014: VendorRevision object is not valid.
    • Error 229024: Unable to get VendorRoles from VendorRevision.
    • Error 229022: Unable to add specified VendorRole.

OperationParameter.description: It is a list of VendorRoleData structures meant to hold data for VendorRole objects to be processed.
OperationParameter.name: vendorRoles

OperationParameter.description: Reference to the VendorRevision object in the context of which these roles are to be processed.
OperationParameter.name: vendorRevRef

OperationTemplate.description:
This service operation creates or updates a group of BidPackageLineItem objects in the context of the mentioned BidPackage. This operation allows the user to find or create a set of BidPackageLineItem objects based on the input data. It first tries to find the existence of the specified BidPackageLineItem for the specified BidPackage. If the specified BidPackageLineItem is found, then its corresponding data will be updated. Otherwise, it will create the specified BidPackageLineItem and associate it to the specified BidPackageRevision. If the specified BidPackageLineItem objects exist and any of the input attribute values differ from those already set, the BidPackageLineItem objects will be updated.

The operation is now deprecated. It is now replaced by Teamcenter::Soa::Vendormanagement::VendorManagement::createOrUpdateLineItemsWithType.
OperationTemplate.name: Teamcenter::Soa::Vendormanagement::VendorManagement::createOrUpdateLineItems
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
Standard Teamcenter ServiceData instance is returned. Failure will be with client id and error message in the ServiceData.

Typical Errors returned are:
    • Errors 29006, 29013 while creating or updating Line Items
    • Low level relation ITK errors while adding the BidPackageLineItem objects to the BidPackageRevision.
    • Errors 29006, 29013, 29020 while processing rules (Revision, Variant or Closure) for LineItemConfigContext.

OperationParameter.description: A list of LineItemProps structures which are used to create or update BidPackageLineItem objects.
OperationParameter.name: properties

OperationParameter.description: Reference to the BidPackageRevision object which will be used to associate the created BidPackageLineItem objects.
OperationParameter.name: bidPackage

OperationTemplate.description: This service operation creates or updates a group of BidPackageLineItem objects and any subtype of it in the context of the mentioned BidPackage. This operation allows the user to find or create a set of BidPackageLineItem objects based on the input data. It first tries to find the existence of the specified BidPackageLineItem for the specified BidPackage. If the specified BidPackageLineItem is found, then the its data will be updated. Otherwise, it will create the specified BidPackageLineItem and associate it to the specified BidPackageRevision. If the specified BidPackageLineItem objects exist and any of the input attribute values differ from those already set, they will be updated.
OperationTemplate.name: Teamcenter::Soa::Vendormanagement::VendorManagement::createOrUpdateLineItemsWithType
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
Standard Teamcenter ServiceData instance is returned. Failure will be with client id and error message in the ServiceData.

Typical Errors returned are:

    • Errors 9006, 29013 while creating or updating BidPackageLineItem objects.
    • Low level relation ITK errors while adding the BidPackageLineItem objects to the BidPackageRevision.
    • Errors 29006, 29013, 29020 while processing rules (Revision, Variant or Closure) for LineItemConfigContext.

OperationParameter.description: A list of LineItemPropertiesWithType structures which are used to create or update BidPackageLineItem objects.
OperationParameter.name: properties

OperationParameter.description: Reference to the BidPackageRevision object which will be used to associate the created BidPackageLineItem objects.
OperationParameter.name: bidPackage

OperationTemplate.description: This service operation deletes the BidPackageLineItem objects associated with a specific BidPackageRevision. The BidPackageLineItem objects to be deleted are searched with their names provided through the input data structures LineItemProps. Hence there will be one entry in the input vector 'input' per BidPackageLineItem to be deleted. There will be one call each for every BidPackageRevision for which BidPackageLineItem objects are to be deleted.
OperationTemplate.name: Teamcenter::Soa::Vendormanagement::VendorManagement::deleteLineItems
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
Standard Teamcenter ServiceData structure. It will contain all the partial errors and failures if any with specific client Ids.

Typical Errors possible are:
    • Error 48008: BidPackage with given Id not found.
    • Error 48161: Error Multiple BidPackage objects with given Id found.
    • Error 48014: Specified BidPackageRevision not found.
    • Error 48006: Error in deleting the specific BidPackageLineItem.

OperationParameter.description: List of LineItemProps structures which denote the exact BidPackageLineItem to be deleted. Out of all the members of this structure, name is needed to be populated as it will be used as the key for search within specified BidPackage Context.
OperationParameter.name: input

OperationParameter.description: This is reference to BidPackageProps structure used to define context to look for BidPackageLineItem objects. ItemId and RevId need to be populated for this structure to accurately define the BidPackageRevision, which will be used to look for BidPackageLineItem objects to be deleted.
OperationParameter.name: bidPackage

OperationTemplate.description: This service operation deletes specified VendorRole objects attached with VendorRevision objects mentioned through VendorProperties data structure. VendorRevision is specified through vendor ID and Revision name in VendorProperties. The combination to be specified thus is 'vendorId + revId + roleType'. So, this combination denotes that there will be one instance of VendorProperties per VendorRole to be deleted. In case of VendorRevision is not found based on the Id and Revision key, this operation will return an error.
OperationTemplate.name: Teamcenter::Soa::Vendormanagement::VendorManagement::deleteVendorRoles
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
Standard Teamcenter ServiceData structure. It will contain all the partial errors and failures such as mentioned below, if any, with specific client Ids.
    • In case multiple vendors are found with same ItemId and RevId combination, the service operation will throw error 48161.
    • Error 229004 will be thrown in case the VendorRole could not be deleted.

OperationParameter.description: The input is a list of VendorProperties structures. There will be an entry for each of the VendorRole objects to be deleted.
OperationParameter.name: input

OperationTemplate.description: This service operation deletes Vendor objects and associated VendorRevision objects and VendorRole objects. When provided with the input in the form of VendorProperties structure, the operation finds the specified Vendor objects and deletes them. VendorRole objects will also be deleted along with the associated VendorRevision objects and Vendor objects.
OperationTemplate.name: Teamcenter::Soa::Vendormanagement::VendorManagement::deleteVendors
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
The operation returns standard ServiceData object. The partial errors and failures are updated and returned thru this object. The success of the operation must be checked through this object only.
Typical errors possible are:
    • Error 48006: Unable to delete the specified Item (Vendor).
    • Error 48035: Error Unable to delete the specified ItemRevision (VendorRevision).
    • Error 48008: Vendor with specified ID is not found.

OperationParameter.description: A list of VectorProperties structures which are used to search for Vendor objects for deletion operation.
OperationParameter.name: input

OperationTemplate.description: This service operation creates or updates a group of BidPackage, BidPackageRevision objects. This operation allows the user to find or create a set of BidPackage objects based on the input data. The service first tries to find the existence of the specified BidPackage or BidPackageRevision. If the specified BidPackage objects exist and any of the input attribute values differ from those already set, the BidPackage objects will be updated.
OperationTemplate.name: Teamcenter::Soa::Vendormanagement::VendorManagement::createOrUpdateBidPackages
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
A list of CreateBidPacksOutput structures. These structures contain information about the BidPackages, BidPackageRevisions.
Failures are returned through ServiceData with client id and error message.

Typical errors returned can be:
    • Error 48161: Multiple BidPackage objects existing with the specified itemId Id
    • Error 48005, 48032: Unable to create BidPackage or BidPackageRevision.

OperationParameter.description: A list of BidPackageProps structures which are used to create or update BidPackage objects.
OperationParameter.name: properties

OperationParameter.description: A parent object reference with which the created BidPackage objects will be associated.
OperationParameter.name: container

OperationParameter.description: A relation name to be used for associating the BidPackage to its parent.
OperationParameter.name: relationType

OperationTemplate.description:
This service operation creates or updates a group of VendorPart objects or CommericialPart objects. The choice could be either CommercialPart or VendorPart only. This operation allows the user to update or create a set of CommercialPart objects or VendorPart objects based on the input data. It first tries to find the existence of the specified VendorPart or VendorPartRevision. If the specified parts are found, those parts will be updated with the specified values. Otherwise new parts will be created.
The choice for type of part is given through data member type of VendorPartProperties structure. Only 'ManufacturerPart' and 'CommercialPart' are valid types.
Behavior for CommercialPart: The service will create the CommercialPart and CommercialPartRevision and it will associate the created CommercialPart to the specified parent (container). It also associates the part to the specified Vendor object if given.
Behavior for ManufacturerPart: The service will create the ManufacturerPart and ManufacturerPartRevision and will associate the part to the specified Vendor object. It also associates the created ManufacturerPart to the CommercialPart if specified.
OperationTemplate.name: Teamcenter::Soa::Vendormanagement::VendorManagement::createOrUpdateVendorParts
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
CreateVendorPartsResponse object returned contains a list of CreateVendorPartsOutput structures which contain information about the VendorPart and VendorPartRevision. Failure will be with client id and error message in the ServiceData structure returned from within the CreateVendorPartsResponse object.

Typical errors returned are:
    • 48161 - Multiple Vendor objects existing with the specified Vendor Id
    • 29020 - Unable to create Vendor or CommercialPart or respective PartRevision.
    • 35002 - Unable to add specified Vendor to the VendorPart.
    • 35002, 35013 - Cannot relate created or updated VendorPart to the specified CommercialPart or PartRevision.
    • 35013, 35006 - Unable to add VendorPart to the parent Business Object.
    • 29024 - Unable to create VendorPart due to invalid release status of the Vendor & its latest revision specified.

OperationParameter.description:
A list of VectorPartProperties structures which are used to create or update VendorPart objects or CommercialPart objects.

VendorPartProperties
The information about each VendorPart to be processed is provided by way of the VendorPartProperties data structure.
OperationParameter.name: properties

OperationParameter.description: A parent object reference with which the created parts will be associated.
OperationParameter.name: container

OperationParameter.description: A relation name to be used for associating the Vendor to its parent.
OperationParameter.name: relationType

OperationTemplate.description: This operation creates a set of ManufacturerPart objects of given type based on input data.This operation is applicable for bulk creation of Vendor Part objects.
OperationTemplate.name: Teamcenter::Soa::Vendormanagement::VendorManagement::createVendorParts
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
CreateVendorPartsResponse object returned contains a list of CreateVendorPartsOutput structures which contain information about the VendorPart and VendorPartRevision. Failure will be with client id and error message in the ServiceData structure returned from within the CreateVendorPartsResponse object.

Possible errors returned in ServiceData are :
229021 - An Invalid Company Location was given.
229013 - The object type is invalid.
229028 - A Part name must be provided to create the Vendor Part.

OperationParameter.description: A list of VendorPartProperties2 structures which are used to create ManufacturerPart objects. The information about each ManufacturerPart to be processed is provided by the way of VendorPartProperties2 structure.
OperationParameter.name: properties

OperationTemplate.description: This service operation creates or updates a group of Vendor, VendorRevision Objects and VendorRole objects. It allows the user to update or create a set of Vendor objects based on the input data. The service first tries to find the existence of the specified Vendor or VendorRevision or VendorRole. If the service is able to find any of those objects, then those objects will be updated. If the service is not able to find those objects, then those objects will be created. If the Vendor exists, but VendorRevision does not, then VendorRevision and VendorRole (and VendorRole form) will be created. If the specified Vendor object and its associated objects exist and any of the input attribute values differ from those already set, the Vendor and its associated objects will be updated.
OperationTemplate.name: Teamcenter::Soa::Vendormanagement::VendorManagement::createOrUpdateVendors
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
CreateVendorsResponse is the returned object. It contains the output in the form of list of CreateVendorsOutput structures which contain information about the Vendor, VendorRevision Objects and VendorRole objects. It also contains standard Teamcenter ServiceData structure. Failure will be with client id and potential error messages as mentioned below in the ServiceData.

Typical errors returned can be:
    • Error 48161: Multiple Vendor objects existing with the specified Vendor Id
    • Error 48005: Unable to create Vendor or VendorRevision or VendorRole or VendorRoleForm.
    • Error 267023: Unable to add created VendorRole to the VendorRevision
    • Error 35002: Unable to add Vendor to the parent Business Object.

OperationParameter.description: A list of VendorProperties structures which are used to create or update the Vendor objects.
OperationParameter.name: properties

OperationParameter.description: A parent object reference to which the created Vendor objects will be associated.
OperationParameter.name: container

OperationParameter.description: A relation name to be used for associating the Vendor to its parent.
OperationParameter.name: relationType

OperationTemplate.description:
This service operation can be called on either a VendorPart or a Vendor.

For VendorPart: It creates a new copy of VendorPart with the new Vendor information. This newly created VendorPart is associated to the new revision of the CommercialPart of the old VendorPart.
For Vendor: All VendorPart objects related with given Vendor are taken into consideration. Each of these VendorPart objects are then processed as mentioned above.

This operation shows old and new part id with the information of the success or failure.

Typical Client Usage:
Typical usage involves two Vendor objects and a VendorPart created with either one of them.

VendorManagementService vmService =
VendorManagementService.getService(session);
ChangeVendorInputInfo[]chanProps = new ChangeVendorInputInfo[1];
ChangeVendorInputInfo changeProps = new ChangeVendorInputInfo();
ChangeVendorResponse response = null;
changeProps.newVendor = (TCComponentVendor)newVendor;
changeProps.vendorParts=selectedParts;
chanProps[0] = changeProps;

response = vmService.changeVendor( chanProps );
OperationTemplate.name: Teamcenter::Soa::Vendormanagement::VendorManagement::changeVendor
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
ChangeVendorResponse structure returned contains information about the updated VendorParts and their statuses along with the notes if any.
List of ChangeVendorStatus structure contains:
A String list of Number of old VendorPart Ids before performing the change Vendor operation.
A String list of Number of new VendorPart Ids after performing the change Vendor operation.
A String list of Remarks (notes) corresponding to the each change Vendor operation. e.g. "Success", "Failure".

Typical errors returned are:
    • Error 229013: Invalid Id supplied for New Vendor
    • Error 229013: Invalid Id for old Vendor to change
    • Error 48005: Cannot create a new VendorPart
    • Error 48043: VendorPart with given credentials already exists
    • Error 229024: Cannot find either Vendor to change or VendorPart objects to change.



ChangeVendorResponse
Response structure for the operation contains statuses member. It is a list of ChangeVendorStatus structures.

struct ChangeVendorResponse
{
    vector statuses;
    Teamcenter::Soa::Client::ServiceData serviceData;
}

    • statuses    List of ChangeVendorStatus structures. There is an entry per entry in input structure.
    • serviceData    Standard ServiceData structure. It contains partial errors and failures along with the clientIds.


ChangeVendorStatus
This is the structure containing a list of structures for each VendorPart statuses.

struct ChangeVendorStatus
{
    vector changedStatus;
}

    • changedStatus    This structure contains the status of VendorPart objects and remarks from the operation.


ChangedPartStatus
This is the structure containing a list of statuses for change Vendor operation.

struct ChangedPartStatus
{
    string oldPartStr;
    string newPartStr;
    string notes;
}

    • oldPartStr    Id of old VendorPart.
    • newPartStr    Id of new VendorPart created.
    • Notes    Remarks (notes) corresponding to the each change Vendor operation. e.g. "Success" Failure".

OperationParameter.description:
input is a list of ChangeVendorInputInfo structures. If a Vendor is supplied in the list, all the related parts are processed. If VendorPart objects are supplied, they are processed one by one for changing Vendor.

ChangeVendorInputInfo
Input structure containing Vendor to change, VendorPart to change and destination new Vendor.

struct ChangeVendorInputInfo
{
    Teamcenter::Soa::Client::Model::Vendor* vendorToChange;
    vector< Teamcenter::Soa::Client::Model::Item* > vendorParts;
    Teamcenter::Soa::Client::Model::Vendor* newVendor;
}

    • vendorToChange    This is Object pointing to the Vendor to change. If this input is specified, all the related VendorPart objects are processed for change Vendor operation. This input takes precedence over VendorPart objects input.
    • vendorParts    VendorPart objects to be processed for change Vendor operation.
    • newVendor    The new Vendor to be attached to the part.
OperationParameter.name: input

OperationTemplate.description: This service operation returns VendorPart objects associated with the given CommercialPartRevision based on the selection rule set for the VendorPart objects in Structure Manager. If no value is given for the selection rule, it is read from the preference VMS_vendor_part_selection_rule. Typical OOTB selection rules provided are showAllVendorParts and showPreferredVendorPartsOnly. First selection rule is to show all related VendorPart objects and later is used to show the related VendorPart objects carrying preferred status.
OperationTemplate.name: Teamcenter::Soa::Vendormanagement::VendorManagement::getVendorPartsWithSelRule
OperationTemplate.returnDescription: GetVendorPartsWithSelRuleResponse contains a list of vendorPartData structures. vendorPartData structure essentially consists of an list of collection of VendorPart objects and its relation objects with CommercialPartRevision objects.

OperationParameter.description: List of GetVendorPartsWithSelRuleInputInfo structures containing CommercialPartRevision objects to be used as input to find related VendorPart objects. It also contains condition name string.
OperationParameter.name: input

Operation.description: This operation adds or removes set of roles to/from a VendorRevision. Typically a role can be assigned to a VendorRevision by adding a role form with different role specific information. OOTB VendorRevision can be assigned with 3 roles namely Distributor, Supplier and Manufacturer. All these role forms contain information about the Vendor based on the type of the role. Similarly a role can be revoked from a VendorRevision. When a Vendor is revised, the new revision inherits all the assigned roles to the previous VendorRevision.
Operation.name: addRemoveVendorRoles
Operation.returnDescription:
The partial errors and failures are updated and returned through the object ServiceData.
Typical errors returned are:
    • Error 480014: VendorRevision object is not valid.
    • Error 229024: Unable to get VendorRoles from VendorRevision.
    • Error 229022: Unable to add specified VendorRole.

ParameterInfo.description: It is a list of VendorRoleData structures meant to hold data for VendorRole objects to be processed.
Reference to the VendorRevision object in the context of which these roles are to be processed.

For VendorPart: It creates a new copy of VendorPart with the new Vendor information. This newly created VendorPart is associated to the new revision of the CommercialPart of the old VendorPart.
For Vendor: All VendorPart objects related with given Vendor are taken into consideration. Each of these VendorPart objects are then processed as mentioned above.
