Operation.description: This service operation creates or updates a group of BidPackage, BidPackageRevision objects. This operation allows the user to find or create a set of BidPackage objects based on the input data. The service first tries to find the existence of the specified BidPackage or BidPackageRevision. If the specified BidPackage objects exist and any of the input attribute values differ from those already set, the BidPackage objects will be updated.
Operation.name: createOrUpdateBidPackages
Operation.returnDescription:
A list of CreateBidPacksOutput structures. These structures contain information about the BidPackages, BidPackageRevisions.
Failures are returned through ServiceData with client id and error message.

Typical errors returned can be:
    • Error 48161: Multiple BidPackage objects existing with the specified itemId Id
    • Error 48005, 48032: Unable to create BidPackage or BidPackageRevision.

ParameterInfo.description: A list of BidPackageProps structures which are used to create or update BidPackage objects.
A parent object reference with which the created BidPackage objects will be associated.
A relation name to be used for associating the BidPackage to its parent.

Operation.description:
This service operation creates or updates a group of BidPackageLineItem objects in the context of the mentioned BidPackage. This operation allows the user to find or create a set of BidPackageLineItem objects based on the input data. It first tries to find the existence of the specified BidPackageLineItem for the specified BidPackage. If the specified BidPackageLineItem is found, then the BidPackageLineItem data will be updated. Otherwise, it will create the specified BidPackageLineItem and associate it to the specified BidPackageRevision. If the specified BidPackageLineItem objects exist and any of the input attribute values differ from those already set, the BidPackageLineItem objects will be updated.
The operation is now deprecated. It is now replaced by Teamcenter::Soa::Vendormanagement::VendorManagement::createOrUpdateLineItemsWithType.
Operation.name: createOrUpdateLineItems
Operation.returnDescription:
Standard Teamcenter ServiceData instance is returned. Failure will be with client id and error message in the ServiceData.

Typical errors returned are:
    • Error 229024: Error while creating or updating BidPackageLineItems
    • Error 229020: Error while adding the BidPackageLineItems to the BidPackageRevision.
    • Error 48014, 229024: Errors while processing rules (Revision, Variant or Closure) for LineItemConfigContext.

ParameterInfo.description: A list of LineItemPropsWithType structures which are used to create or update BidPackageLineItem objects.
Reference to the BidPackageRevision object which will be used to associate the created BidPackageLineItem objects.

Operation.description:
This service operation creates or updates a group of BidPackageLineItem objects in the context of the mentioned BidPackage. This operation allows the user to find or create a set of BidPackageLineItem objects based on the input data. It first tries to find the existence of the specified BidPackageLineItem for the specified BidPackage. If the specified BidPackageLineItem is found, then its corresponding data will be updated. Otherwise, it will create the specified BidPackageLineItem and associate it to the specified BidPackageRevision. If the specified BidPackageLineItem objects exist and any of the input attribute values differ from those already set, the BidPackageLineItem objects will be updated.

The operation is now deprecated. It is now replaced by Teamcenter::Soa::Vendormanagement::VendorManagement::createOrUpdateLineItemsWithType.
Operation.name: createOrUpdateLineItems
Operation.returnDescription:
Standard Teamcenter ServiceData instance is returned. Failure will be with client id and error message in the ServiceData.

Typical Errors returned are:
    • Errors 29006, 29013 while creating or updating Line Items
    • Low level relation ITK errors while adding the BidPackageLineItem objects to the BidPackageRevision.
    • Errors 29006, 29013, 29020 while processing rules (Revision, Variant or Closure) for LineItemConfigContext.

ParameterInfo.description: A list of LineItemProps structures which are used to create or update BidPackageLineItem objects.
Reference to the BidPackageRevision object which will be used to associate the created BidPackageLineItem objects.

Operation.description: This service operation creates or updates a group of BidPackageLineItem objects and any subtype of it in the context of the mentioned BidPackage. This operation allows the user to find or create a set of BidPackageLineItem objects based on the input data. It first tries to find the existence of the specified BidPackageLineItem for the specified BidPackage. If the specified BidPackageLineItem is found, then the its data will be updated. Otherwise, it will create the specified BidPackageLineItem and associate it to the specified BidPackageRevision. If the specified BidPackageLineItem objects exist and any of the input attribute values differ from those already set, they will be updated.
Operation.name: createOrUpdateLineItemsWithType
Operation.returnDescription:
Standard Teamcenter ServiceData instance is returned. Failure will be with client id and error message in the ServiceData.

Typical Errors returned are:

    • Errors 9006, 29013 while creating or updating BidPackageLineItem objects.
    • Low level relation ITK errors while adding the BidPackageLineItem objects to the BidPackageRevision.
    • Errors 29006, 29013, 29020 while processing rules (Revision, Variant or Closure) for LineItemConfigContext.

ParameterInfo.description: A list of LineItemPropertiesWithType structures which are used to create or update BidPackageLineItem objects.
Reference to the BidPackageRevision object which will be used to associate the created BidPackageLineItem objects.

Operation.description:
This service operation creates or updates a group of VendorPart objects or CommericialPart objects. The choice could be either CommercialPart or VendorPart only. This operation allows the user to update or create a set of CommercialPart objects or VendorPart objects based on the input data. It first tries to find the existence of the specified VendorPart or VendorPartRevision. If the specified parts are found, those parts will be updated with the specified values. Otherwise new parts will be created.
The choice for type of part is given through data member type of VendorPartProperties structure. Only 'ManufacturerPart' and 'CommercialPart' are valid types.
Behavior for CommercialPart: The service will create the CommercialPart and CommercialPartRevision and it will associate the created CommercialPart to the specified parent (container). It also associates the part to the specified Vendor object if given.
Behavior for ManufacturerPart: The service will create the ManufacturerPart and ManufacturerPartRevision and will associate the part to the specified Vendor object. It also associates the created ManufacturerPart to the CommercialPart if specified.
Operation.name: createOrUpdateVendorParts
Operation.returnDescription:
CreateVendorPartsResponse object returned contains a list of CreateVendorPartsOutput structures which contain information about the VendorPart and VendorPartRevision. Failure will be with client id and error message in the ServiceData structure returned from within the CreateVendorPartsResponse object.

Typical errors returned are:
    • 48161 - Multiple Vendor objects existing with the specified Vendor Id
    • 29020 - Unable to create Vendor or CommercialPart or respective PartRevision.
    • 35002 - Unable to add specified Vendor to the VendorPart.
    • 35002, 35013 - Cannot relate created or updated VendorPart to the specified CommercialPart or PartRevision.
    • 35013, 35006 - Unable to add VendorPart to the parent Business Object.
    • 29024 - Unable to create VendorPart due to invalid release status of the Vendor & its latest revision specified.

ParameterInfo.description:
A list of VectorPartProperties structures which are used to create or update VendorPart objects or CommercialPart objects.

VendorPartProperties
The information about each VendorPart to be processed is provided by way of the VendorPartProperties data structure.
A parent object reference with which the created parts will be associated.
A relation name to be used for associating the Vendor to its parent.

Operation.description: This service operation creates or updates a group of Vendor, VendorRevision Objects and VendorRole objects. It allows the user to update or create a set of Vendor objects based on the input data. The service first tries to find the existence of the specified Vendor or VendorRevision or VendorRole. If the service is able to find any of those objects, then those objects will be updated. If the service is not able to find those objects, then those objects will be created. If the Vendor exists, but VendorRevision does not, then VendorRevision and VendorRole (and VendorRole form) will be created. If the specified Vendor object and its associated objects exist and any of the input attribute values differ from those already set, the Vendor and its associated objects will be updated.
Operation.name: createOrUpdateVendors
Operation.returnDescription:
CreateVendorsResponse is the returned object. It contains the output in the form of list of CreateVendorsOutput structures which contain information about the Vendor, VendorRevision Objects and VendorRole objects. It also contains standard Teamcenter ServiceData structure. Failure will be with client id and potential error messages as mentioned below in the ServiceData.

Typical errors returned can be:
    • Error 48161: Multiple Vendor objects existing with the specified Vendor Id
    • Error 48005: Unable to create Vendor or VendorRevision or VendorRole or VendorRoleForm.
    • Error 267023: Unable to add created VendorRole to the VendorRevision
    • Error 35002: Unable to add Vendor to the parent Business Object.

DeprecationInfo.deprecatedDescription: This operation is deprecated in TC 10.0. Replaced by new operation addRemoveVendorRoles.

ParameterInfo.description: A list of VendorProperties structures which are used to create or update the Vendor objects.
A parent object reference to which the created Vendor objects will be associated.
A relation name to be used for associating the Vendor to its parent.

Operation.description: This operation creates a set of ManufacturerPart objects of given type based on input data.This operation is applicable for bulk creation of Vendor Part objects.
Operation.name: createVendorParts
Operation.returnDescription:
CreateVendorPartsResponse object returned contains a list of CreateVendorPartsOutput structures which contain information about the VendorPart and VendorPartRevision. Failure will be with client id and error message in the ServiceData structure returned from within the CreateVendorPartsResponse object.

Possible errors returned in ServiceData are :
229021 - An Invalid Company Location was given.
229013 - The object type is invalid.
229028 - A Part name must be provided to create the Vendor Part.
Operation.useCase: Create Vendor Parts in bulk,when Vendor is already created and CompanyLocation can be available with Vendor.

ParameterInfo.description: A list of VendorPartProperties2 structures which are used to create ManufacturerPart objects. The information about each ManufacturerPart to be processed is provided by the way of VendorPartProperties2 structure.

Operation.description: This service operation deletes the BidPackageLineItem objects associated with a specific BidPackageRevision. The BidPackageLineItem objects to be deleted are searched with their names provided through the input data structures LineItemProps. Hence there will be one entry in the input vector 'input' per BidPackageLineItem to be deleted. There will be one call each for every BidPackageRevision for which BidPackageLineItem objects are to be deleted.
Operation.name: deleteLineItems
Operation.returnDescription:
Standard Teamcenter ServiceData structure. It will contain all the partial errors and failures if any with specific client Ids.

Typical Errors possible are:
    • Error 48008: BidPackage with given Id not found.
    • Error 48161: Error Multiple BidPackage objects with given Id found.
    • Error 48014: Specified BidPackageRevision not found.
    • Error 48006: Error in deleting the specific BidPackageLineItem.

ParameterInfo.description: List of LineItemProps structures which denote the exact BidPackageLineItem to be deleted. Out of all the members of this structure, name is needed to be populated as it will be used as the key for search within specified BidPackage Context.

This is reference to BidPackageProps structure used to define context to look for BidPackageLineItem objects. ItemId and RevId need to be populated for this structure to accurately define the BidPackageRevision, which will be used to look for BidPackageLineItem objects to be deleted.

Operation.description: This service operation deletes specified VendorRole objects attached with VendorRevision objects mentioned through VendorProperties data structure. VendorRevision is specified through vendor ID and Revision name in VendorProperties. The combination to be specified thus is 'vendorId + revId + roleType'. So, this combination denotes that there will be one instance of VendorProperties per VendorRole to be deleted. In case of VendorRevision is not found based on the Id and Revision key, this operation will return an error.
Operation.name: deleteVendorRoles
Operation.returnDescription:
Standard Teamcenter ServiceData structure. It will contain all the partial errors and failures such as mentioned below, if any, with specific client Ids.
    • In case multiple vendors are found with same ItemId and RevId combination, the service operation will throw error 48161.
    • Error 229004 will be thrown in case the VendorRole could not be deleted.

DeprecationInfo.deprecatedDescription: This operation is deprecated in TC 10.0. Replaced by new operation addRemoveVendorRoles.

ParameterInfo.description: The input is a list of VendorProperties structures. There will be an entry for each of the VendorRole objects to be deleted.

Operation.description: This service operation deletes Vendor objects and associated VendorRevision objects and VendorRole objects. When provided with the input in the form of VendorProperties structure, the operation finds the specified Vendor objects and deletes them. VendorRole objects will also be deleted along with the associated VendorRevision objects and Vendor objects.
Operation.name: deleteVendors
Operation.returnDescription:
The operation returns standard ServiceData object. The partial errors and failures are updated and returned thru this object. The success of the operation must be checked through this object only.
Typical errors possible are:
    • Error 48006: Unable to delete the specified Item (Vendor).
    • Error 48035: Error Unable to delete the specified ItemRevision (VendorRevision).
    • Error 48008: Vendor with specified ID is not found.

ParameterInfo.description: A list of VectorProperties structures which are used to search for Vendor objects for deletion operation.

Operation.description:
This service operation concatenates external object id and context id with hyphen to generate a new item id, provided length of concatenated id is less than the desired item id length. This operation also returns existing Item objects that have the generated IDs.
The intent of this operation is to support import of Item objects from external systems. This service operation concatenates external object id and context id with hyphen to generate a new item id, provided length of concatenated id is less than the desired item id length. This operation also returns existing Item objects that have the generated IDs.
The intent of this operation is to support import of Item objects from external systems.
Operation.name: getItemIDwithContext
Operation.returnDescription:
A list of ItemIDData structures which contain item_id and references to existing objects with those IDs. Failure will be with client id and error message in the ServiceData.

Typical Errors returned would be:

    • Error 229016: In case the combination of input.externalObjectID and input.contextID becomes larger than maximum allowed length for item ID (128), it will throw an exception mentioning the same.
    • Error 229009, 48043: Standard exceptions while trying to look for an existing Item with generated Item ID will also be thrown back.

ParameterInfo.description: A structure of external IDs and context IDs. This data is used to generate the Item IDs with context. It will also be used to compare and find out existing Item with such ID.

Operation.description: This service operation returns VendorPart objects associated with the given CommercialPartRevision based on the selection rule set for the VendorPart objects in Structure Manager. If no value is given for the selection rule, it is read from the preference VMS_vendor_part_selection_rule. Typical OOTB selection rules provided are showAllVendorParts and showPreferredVendorPartsOnly. First selection rule is to show all related VendorPart objects and later is used to show the related VendorPart objects carrying preferred status.
Operation.name: getVendorPartsWithSelRule
Operation.returnDescription: GetVendorPartsWithSelRuleResponse contains a list of vendorPartData structures. vendorPartData structure essentially consists of an list of collection of VendorPart objects and its relation objects with CommercialPartRevision objects.

ParameterInfo.description: List of GetVendorPartsWithSelRuleInputInfo structures containing CommercialPartRevision objects to be used as input to find related VendorPart objects. It also contains condition name string.

Operation.description: This internal service operation gets a list of conditions to use for VendorPart Selection Rule. The Response structure returned contains a list of condition names and their expressions.
Operation.name: getVPSRConditions
Operation.returnDescription: <font face="courier" height="10">GetVPSRConditionsResponse</font> structure returned contains a list of <font face="courier" height="10">ConditionData</font> which contains conditions information. Failures will be with client id and error message in the <font face="courier" height="10">ServiceData</font>.
Operation.useCase:
In a typical use case, there is a dialogue to be displayed which will let user select one of the VendorPart Selection Rule conditions.
Once the dialogue is created, it may be populated using this operation.

Functionality.description: Solution template that provides capability to manage vendor relation information.
Functionality.name: Vm0VendorManagement

TcAttribute.description: vm0SentObjectRef is a typed reference property used to store reference to the Teamcenter object for which the data was requested from Supplier. The object is generally a Part, Item, or the Vendor.
vm0ExchangeObjectRef is a typed reference property to store reference to the Exchange object which acts as a placeholder for all other metadata for the exchange event.
Date information of last transaction on the object
vm0ReviewStatus is a string property which stores the verdict of OEM on supplier response. Typically it is after the supplier declaration is put through a review process.
vm0ReviewComments is a string property which stores review comments provided by OEM while reviewing Supplier response.

vm0ReceivedObjectRefs is an untyped reference property which stores the objects which are received as part of the supplier response. Often, it contains reference to declaration datasets or child lines item revisions in case of non-briefcase structure needed for Supplier Collaboration.
vm0ResponseDate is a date property to denote the date on which the response was submitted to OEM. This property is generally populated at the time of creation of the response object.
vm0SRMExchange is a typed reference property used to connect the supplier response to the original exchange event. It is in response to this exchange event, the supplier has sent data.
vm0PostDate is a date property used to denote the date the exchange is posted/sent to Suppliers. The property is generally set at the time of sending the communication to suppliers.
Vm0Status is a string property used to denote the status of exchange. This is an open valued property to suit according to the needs to consuming applications.

vm0StatusReason is a string property used to describe the reason text for status. Most of the times, OEMs will record both status and reason to set the status. The use of this property varied from application to application.

vm0CloseDate is a date property used to store the date of close of exchange with supplier. It may end with receipt of supplier data or with approval of the same. It changes according to the consuming application.

OperationInputProperty.description: Object which needs to be exchanged.
The Exchange object for which response has been submitted.
The date on which the response was submitted.
Child line item revisions added by vendor in case of non-briefcase structure response.

TcForm.description: Saves/Manages/Prepares the transaction information for the exchange with the Vendors/Supplier
Saves/Manages/Prepares the transaction information for the exchange with the Vendors/Supplier

TcStandardType.description: Vm0ExchangeLine object is used to create a placeholder for the data exchange with suppliers when the data is requested. The object represents one instance of the request made for supplier data. The object usually stores information about the object in Teamcenter for which the request was created, the reference to the Exchange object where all the other metadata is stored.The exchange lines also provide for the archival information and reports built for the supplier data in Teamcenter. For this reason, once created, they generally stay unless specifically purged.

Vm0SupplierResponseObject object acts as a place holder for Suppliers response. The response generally happens to be in form of an incoming document or dataset.It is often required to procure data from Suppliers keep the books up to date or to use it across OEM's own processes. In the event of such exchange request, supplier sends the data. This data becomes Supplier Response.Post processes to consume the data often start from this object and its status.

Vm0VendorXChange object Saves/Manages/Prepares the transaction information for the exchange with the Vendors/Supplier. This is the base object and typically it is expected that the consuming applications derive from it and use it according to their needs.This object acts as a placeholder for holding both requests and responses for suppliers. The references are set as back pointers and respective objects have more information. Once created, the object generally stays unless specifically purged.
